intro: Heterotheca thiniicola, commonly known as the narrowleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Heterotheca thiniicola is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
